intro: [WRONG START] Hieracussion sasellae, commonly known as the Sasella hawkweed, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the alpine regions of Italy. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky and moist habitats, showcasing a low-growing habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that give it a dandelion-like appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Hieracium sasellae is considered a vulnerable species.
